alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Irion (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 7:27PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Crockett and southwestern Irion Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 725 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163, or 13 miles south of Barnhart to just west of Barnhart. The storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Rainfall amounts of 1 inch may also produce street flooding. Locations impacted include... The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
